Kementerian ESDM: Solar B30 Siap Diimplementasikan Awal 2020
02 Nov 2019, 02:38 by Ai Rika Rachmawati
BANDUNG, (PR).- Mengoptimalkan potensi energi baru terbarukan (EBT), Kementerian Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral (ESDM) akan memprioritaskan pemanfaatan biodiesel. Pada awal 2020 Kementerian ESDM akan mengimplementasikan mandatori B30, campuran 30% biodiesel pada minyak solar.
Demikiam diungkapkan Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral (ESDM), Arifin Tasrif, melalui siaran pers yang diterima "PR", Jumat, 1 November 2019. Menurut dia, implementasi B30 hanya tinggal memastikan pasokannya.
"Untuk B30 sudah siap, tinggal (memastikan) suplainya, tinggal dijalankan," ujar Arifin.
Seperti diketahui, saat ini bahan bakar minyak (BBM) jenis solar yang beredar di pasaran telah dicampur dengan Bahan Bakar Nabati (biodiesel) sebanyak 20%. BBM solar jenis itu disebut B20.
Kesiapan tersebut, menurut dia, juga tidak lepas dari hasil uji coba penggunaan B30 pada kendaraan bermesin diesel. Setelah diluncurkan pada 3 Juni 2019, uji jalan menggunakan B30 dilakukan pada kendaraan uji kurang dari 3,5 ton dan lebih dari 3,5 ton. 
Hasilnya, pada kendaraan uji kurang dari 3,5 ton menunjukkan tidak ada perbedaan signifikan pada kinerja kendaraan yang menggunakan bahan bakar B30 dibandingkan dengan B20 yang sudah diimplementasikan selama ini. Sementara untuk kendaraan besar (lebih dari 3,5 ton) masih menyelesaikan tahapan uji jalan (road test).
Uji jalan B30 dilakukan oleh Badan Litbang ESDM, dengan melibatkan berbagai Kementerian/Lembaga dan stakeholder terkait. Beberapa stakeholder yang terlibat adalah Badan Pengelola Dana Perkebunan Kelapa Sawit (BPDPKS), Badan Pengkajian dan Penerapan Teknologi (BPPT), Asosiasi Produsen Biofuel Indonesia (APROBI), PT Pertamina (Persero) dan Gabungan Industri Kendaraan Bermotor Indonesia (Gaikindo).
Arifin menuturkan, mandatori B30 tersebut harus segera dilakukan untuk mengakselerasi target bauran EBT. Namun, menurut dia, peralihan dari satu tahap ke tahapan lainnya membutuhkan proses dan evalusi yang berkesinambungan. 
"Harus bertahap, daei B30, B40, lalu B50. Harus dicek kesesuaian dan keamanannya saat diimplementasikan pada sarana transportasi. Bagaimana nilai bakarnya, apakah kendaraan akan bermasalah atau tidak, dll," tutur Arifin.***
Sebelumnya, Presiden Joko Widodo pada Rapat Terbatas (Ratas) tentang Penyampaikan Program dan Kegiatan bidang Kemaritiman dan Investasi, di Kantor Presiden, Jakarta, Rabu (30/10/2019), kembali menekankan kebijakan EBT yang harus dipercepat ke depannya. Hal yang ditekankan Joko Widodo adalah mandatori dari B20 menjadi B30, hingga ke B50 dan B100.***

Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources: B30 Solar Ready to be Implemented in 2020
02 Nov 2019, 02:38 by Ai Rika Rachmawati
BANDUNG, (PR) .- Optimizing the potential for new renewable energy (EBT), the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) will prioritize the use of biodiesel. In early 2020 the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources will implement the mandatory B30, a mixture of 30% biodiesel in diesel oil.
Thus expressed Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM), Arifin Tasrif, through a press release received by "PR", Friday, November 1, 2019. According to him, the implementation of B30 was only to ensure its supply.
"For B30, we are ready, we only need to (ensure) supply, we just need to run it," Arifin said.
As is known, currently diesel fuel (BBM) on the market has been mixed with Biofuel (biodiesel) as much as 20%. This type of diesel fuel is called B20.
The readiness, according to him, also could not be separated from the results of the trial use of B30 on diesel-engined vehicles. After being launched on June 3, 2019, road tests using B30 were carried out on test vehicles of less than 3.5 tons and more than 3.5 tons.
The result, the test vehicle is less than 3.5 tons shows no significant difference in the performance of vehicles that use B30 fuel compared to B20 that has been implemented so far. Meanwhile, for large vehicles (more than 3.5 tons) they are still completing the road test phase.
The B30 road test was carried out by the ESDM Research and Development Agency, involving various Ministries / Institutions and related stakeholders. Some of the stakeholders involved are the Palm Oil Plantation Fund Management Agency (BPDPKS), the Technology Assessment and Application Agency (BPPT), the Indonesian Biofuel Producers Association (APROBI), PT Pertamina (Persero) and the Indonesian Automotive Industries Association (Gaikindo).
Arifin said, the mandatory B30 must be done immediately to accelerate the EBT mix target. However, according to him, the transition from one stage to another requires a process and continuous evaluation.
"It must be gradual, from B30, B40, then B50. Must be checked for suitability and safety when implemented in transportation facilities. What is the fuel value, whether the vehicle will be problematic or not, etc.," said Arifin. ***
Previously, President Joko Widodo at the Limited Meeting (Ratas) on the Delivery of Programs and Activities in the Maritime and Investment Sector, at the Presidential Office, Jakarta, Wednesday (10/30/2019), again emphasized the EBT policy which must be accelerated going forward. The thing emphasized by Joko Widodo is the mandate from B20 to B30, to B50 and B100. ***
